narrative.title: Ii Corps - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: American Army Corps deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: Veteran US Army Corps - combined arms operations at corps level. Completed Tunisia Campaign with decisive victory (Axis surrender May 13, 1943). Proven capability in mountain warfare, mobile armored operations, combined arms coordination. Transitioned from green to veteran status through combat experience including Kasserine Pass defeat, El Guettar victory, Hill 609 assault, and final Bizerte offensive.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Northern Tunisia: mountainous terrain (Djebels), coastal plains, river valleys (Medjerda), captured urban areas (Bizerte, Tunis). Transitioning from combat operations to occupation and Sicily preparation.

special_rules: Combined arms coordination: armor-infantry-artillery-air integration proven
Mobile armored warfare: 1st Armored Division provides breakthrough capability
Mountain/hill assault: 34th Infantry Division proven at Hill 609
Aggressive infantry tactics: 1st Infantry Division 'Big Red One' esprit
Sustained operations: 6 months continuous operations from Torch to Tunisia surrender
Air-ground coordination: Improved XII Air Support Command integration
